message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.NA, cs.IT

The paper proposes a framework that uses deep neural networks for task-adapted reconstruction in ill-posed inverse problems. This involves formalizing the reconstruction and task as appropriate estimators in statistical estimation problems, which suggests a focus on machine learning and statistical methods. The use of neural networks for both steps of the framework further supports the relevance of machine learning and computer vision (cs.CV) as likely sub-categories. Additionally, the paper mentions the exchangeability of the data model associated with the inverse problem, which suggests a focus on numerical analysis (cs.NA) and information theory (cs.IT). Finally, the paper demonstrates the approach on joint tomographic image reconstruction, classification, and segmentation, which suggests a focus on artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
